                                    RESPONSES TO Q.179/180.                     
0                                                                               
                 <ANSWERS TO THE OPEN-ENDED QUESTION Q.179/180 WERE             
                 CLASSIFIED INTO 16 RESPONSE CATEGORIES COMMON TO ALL           
                 COUNTRIES,  PLUS ADDITIONAL COUNTRY-SPECIFIC CATEGORIES.       
                 RESPONSE CATEGORIES COMMON TO ALL COUNTRIES ARE DUBBED         
                 "COMMON CODES" AND ARE ASSIGNED CATEGORY NUMBERS 1 THROUGH     
                 16. CATEGORY NUMBERS 17 THROUGH 24 ARE RESERVED FOR            
                 COUNTRY-SPECIFIC RESPONSE CATEGORIES. THE CLASSIFICATION       
                 SCHEMES OF FRANCE, GERMANY, LUXEMBOURG, NORTHERN IRELAND AND   
                 SPAIN COMPRISE THE COMMON CODES ONLY. THE SCHEMES FOR GREAT    
                 BRITAIN AND THE REMAINING E.C. NATIONS ALSO INCLUDE ONE OR     
                 MORE COUNTRY-SPECIFIC RESPONSE CATEGORIES.                     
                                                                                
                 RESPONSE CATEGORIES ARE REPRESENTED IN THE DATA BY A SERIES    
                 OF 24 VARIABLES, Q.179/180(1) TO Q.179/180(24). THESE          
                 VARIABLES ARE DESIGNATED BY THEIR QUESTION NUMBER AND A        
                 PARENTHESIZED SUFFIX WHICH IDENTIFIES EACH RESPONSE CATEGORY   
                 BY ITS CATEGORY NUMBER. FOR EXAMPLE, Q.179/180(6) REPRESENTS   
                 RESPONSE CATEGORY NUMBER 6, I.E., "ALCOHOLICS, DRUG            
                 ADDICTS."                                                      
                                                                                
                 Q.179/180(1) THROUGH Q.179/180(36) ARE CODED EITHER 1, 0 OR    
                 9:                                                             
                                                                                
                 CODE 1: IF A RESPONDENT'S ANSWER WAS CLASSIFIED AS A           
                 RESPONSE OF THE CATEGORY REPRESENTED BY A GIVEN VARIABLE,      
                 THEN THAT VARIABLE IS CODE 1.                                  
                                                                                
                 CODE 0: IF A RESPONDENT'S ANSWER WAS NOT CLASSIFIED AS A       
                 RESPONSE OF THE CATEGORY REPRESENTED BY A GIVEN VARIABLE,      
                 THEN THAT VARIABLE IS CODE 0.                                  
                                                                                
                 CODE 9: THIS CODE FLAGS INAPPLICABLE RESPONSE CATEGORIES.      
                 EXCEPT FOR BELGIUM, EACH CLASSIFICATION SCHEME FOR THIS        
                 QUESTION HAS LESS THAN 24 CATEGORIES. CONSEQUENTLY, FOR        
                 EVERY COUNTRY EXCEPT BELGIUM, AT LEAST ONE OF THE VARIABLES    
                 RESERVED FOR COUNTRY-SPECIFIC CATEGORIES -- Q.179/180(17)      
                 THROUGH Q.179/180(24) -- DOES NOT REPRESENT ANY RESPONSE       
                 CATEGORY. VARIABLES CORRESPONDING TO CATEGORY NUMBERS THAT     
                 ARE NOT USED WITHIN A GIVEN CLASSIFICATION SCHEME ARE          
                 INAPPLICABLE FOR THE COUNTRY IN QUESTION AND ARE CODED 9 FOR   
                 ALL RESPONDENTS WHO WERE INTERVIEWED THERE.                    
                                                                                
                 CLASSIFICATION SCHEMES FOR EACH COUNTRY ARE SHOWN BELOW.       
                 DESCRIPTIONS OF THE COMMON CODES CATEGORIES ALSO APPEAR        
                 WITHIN THE MAIN BODY OF THE CODEBOOK.>                         
0                                                                               
1             648                                                               
-

0                                      *** NOTE   7 ***                         
                                                                                
                                    RESPONSES TO Q.245/249.                     
0                                                                               
                 <ANSWERS TO THE THE OPEN-ENDED QUESTION 245/249 WERE           
                 CATEGORIZED DIFFERENTLY IN GREAT BRITAIN, NORTHERN IRELAND     
                 AND IN EACH OF THE OTHER 11 E.C. NATIONS. IN ALL, THERE ARE    
                 13 DIFFERENT CLASSIFICATION SCHEMES FOR THIS QUESTION, EACH    
                 COMPRISING FROM 12 TO 48 RESPONSE CATEGORIES.                  
                                                                                
                 RESPONSE CATEGORIES ARE REPRESENTED IN THE DATA BY A SERIES    
                 OF 48 VARIABLES, Q.245/249(1) THROUGH Q.245/249(48). THESE     
                 VARIABLES ARE DESIGNATED BY THEIR QUESTION NUMBER AND A        
                 PARENTHESIZED SUFFIX WHICH IDENTIFIES EACH RESPONSE CATEGORY   
                 BY ITS CATEGORY NUMBER. THUS, FOR EXAMPLE, Q.245/249(6)        
                 REPRESENTS RESPONSE CATEGORY NUMBER 6, I.E., "INCREASE IN      
                 EXCHANGES" FOR FRENCH RESPONDENTS, "FREE COMPETITION, MORE     
                 COMPETITION" FOR BELGIAN RESPONDENTS, AND SO ON.               
                                                                                
                 Q.245/249(1) THROUGH Q.245/249(48) ARE CODED 1, 0 OR 9:        
                                                                                
                 CODE 1: IF A RESPONDENT'S ANSWER WAS CLASSIFIED AS A           
                 RESPONSE OF THE CATEGORY REPRESENTED BY A GIVEN VARIABLE,      
                 THEN THAT VARIABLE IS CODED 1.                                 
                                                                                
                 CODE 0: IF A RESPONDENT'S ANSWER WAS NOT CLASSIFIED AS A       
                 RESPONSE OF THE CATEGORY REPRESENTED BY A GIVEN VARIABLE,      
                 THEN THAT VARIABLE IS CODED 0.                                 
                                                                                
                 CODE 9: THIS CODE FLAGS INAPPLICABLE RESPONSE CATEGORIES. IF   
                 A CATEGORY NUMBER (1-48) IS NOT USED WITHIN A GIVEN            
                 CLASSIFICATION SCHEME BECAUSE THE SCHEME HAS LESS THAN 48      
                 RESPONSE CATEGORIES, THEN THE VARIABLE REPRESENTING THE        
                 UNUSED CATEGORY IS INAPPLICABLE FOR THE COUNTRY IN QUESTION    
                 AND IS CODED 9 FOR ALL RESPONDENTS WHO WERE INTERVIEWED        
                 THERE.                                                         
                                                                                
                 NOTE: THERE IS AN ADDITIONAL VARIABLE, Q.245/249(R), WHICH     
                 SUMMARIZES RESPONSES TO Q.245/249 ON BALANCE AS BEING          
                 POSITIVE, NEGATIVE OR NEUTRAL. Q.245/249(R) IMMEDIATELY        
                 FOLLOWS Q.245/249(48) IN THE DATA.                             
                                                                                
                 NOTE: FRANCE HAS AN UNDOCUMENTED CATEGORY FOR THIS QUESTION.   
                 ICPSR WILL SUPPLY THIS MISSING INFORMATION TO OUR DATA USERS   
                 AS SOON AS IT IS RECEIVED FROM THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS.    
                                                                                
                 CLASSIFICATION SCHEMES FOR EACH COUNTRY ARE SHOWN BELOW.>      
0                                                                               
                 FRANCE                                                         
                                                                                
1             652                                                               
-                                                                               
                  1.  UNITY, UNIFICATION, PEACE IN EUROPE, COMMON               
                      FEELING ACROSS COUNTRIES, SENSE OF BELONGING              
                  2.  FREE MOVEMENT OF GOODS                                    
                  3.  FREE MOVEMENT OF PEOPLE, NO MORE NATIONAL                 
                      PASSPORTS, A NEW EUROPEAN PASSPORT                        
                  4.  HARMONIZATION OF VAT RATES                                
                  5.  <UNDOCUMENTED RESPONSE CATEGORY>                          
                  6.  INCREASE IN EXCHANGES                                     
                  7.  COMMON CURRENCY, ECU                                      
                  8.  EVOLUTION IN EVERY FIELD                                  
                  9.  UNEMPLOYMENT, DIFFICULTIES IN FIRMS, WE ARE               
                      HEADING TO MORE AND MORE TROUBLE                          
                 10.  UNITED STATES OF EUROPE, A POWER VERSUS USA AND           
                      USSR, THE WORLD-WIDE FIRST ECONOMIC POWER                 
                 11.  COMPETITION, FREE COMPETITION, INCREASING COMPETITION     
                 12.  A BORDERLESS EUROPE, A EUROPE FREE OF BORDERS             
                 13.  REMOVING CUSTOMS BARRIERS AND DUTIES                      
                 14.  BRINGING TOGETHER DIFFERENT CULTURES                      
                 15.  DEEP CHANGE IN THE WAYS OF LIFE                           
                 16.  IT FRIGHTENS ME, I AM AGAINST, IT WILL FAIL               
                 17.  COMPLICATIONS WITH HARMONIZATION OF THE LAWS              
                 19.  NOTHING                                                   
                 20.  OTHER                                                     
                 21.  DON'T KNOW                                                
                 22.  EUROPEAN MARKET OF EMPLOYMENT, MORE EMPLOYMENT            
                 23.  FREEDOM TO WORK IN ANY COUNTRY, EQUIVALENCE               
                      BETWEEN DIPLOMAS                                          
                 24.  LOSS OF FRENCH HEGEMONY, GERMAN LEADERSHIP,               
                      NECESSITY TO LEARN OTHER LANGUAGES                        
0                                                                               
                 BELGIUM                                                        
                                                                                
                 (FIRST ANSWER)                                                 
                                                                                
                  1.  ELIMINATION OF THE BORDERS, FREE CIRCULATION OF           
                      PERSONS AND GOODS

                      INSTITUTIONS; DEMOCRATIZATION; ETC...

                      ORIENTATION: POSITIVE. EXAMPLES OF ANSWERS: SATURATION

                      EUROPEAN COUNTRIES EASILY AND/OR AT LOW PRICES; ETC...

                      AWAY FOOD TO RUSSIANS AT RIDICULOUSLY LOW PRICE; FOOD     
                      TOO EXPENSIVE; FARMERS DO NOT GET ADEQUATE HELP;          
                      ETC...

                 10.  TOPIC: OTHER (I.E. NON AGRICULTURAL) EUROPEAN

                      OR NEUTRAL.

                      TOPICS. ORIENTATION: POSITIVE.

0                                      *** NOTE   8 ***                         
                                                                                
                                    RESPONSES TO Q.268/270.                     
0                                                                               
                 <ANSWERS TO THE THE OPEN-ENDED QUESTION 268/270 WERE           
                 CATEGORIZED DIFFERENTLY IN GREAT BRITAIN, NORTHERN IRELAND     
                 AND IN EACH OF THE OTHER 11 E.C. NATIONS. IN ALL, THERE ARE    
                 13 DIFFERENT CLASSIFICATION SCHEMES FOR THIS QUESTION, EACH    
                 COMPRISING FROM 12 TO 36 RESPONSE CATEGORIES.                  
                                                                                
                 RESPONSE CATEGORIES ARE REPRESENTED IN THE DATA BY A SERIES    
                 OF 36 VARIABLES, Q.268/270(1) THROUGH Q.268/270(36). THESE     
                 VARIABLES ARE DESIGNATED BY THEIR QUESTION NUMBER AND A        
                 PARENTHESIZED SUFFIX WHICH IDENTIFIES EACH RESPONSE CATEGORY   
                 BY ITS CATEGORY NUMBER. THUS, FOR EXAMPLE, Q.268/270(6)        
                 REPRESENTS RESPONSE CATEGORY NUMBER 6, I.E., "TURKS" FOR       
                 FRENCH RESPONDENTS, "INHABITANTS OF ZAIRE" FOR BELGIAN         
                 RESPONDENTS, AND SO ON.                                        
                                                                                
                 Q.268/270(1) THROUGH Q.268/270(36) ARE CODED EITHER 1, 0 OR    
                 9:                                                             
                                                                                
                 CODE 1: IF A RESPONDENT'S ANSWER WAS CLASSIFIED AS A           
                 RESPONSE OF THE CATEGORY REPRESENTED BY A GIVEN VARIABLE,      
                 THEN THAT VARIABLE IS CODED 1.                                 
                                                                                
                 CODE 0: IF A RESPONDENT'S ANSWER WAS NOT CLASSIFIED AS A       
                 RESPONSE OF THE CATEGORY REPRESENTED BY A GIVEN VARIABLE,      
                 THEN THAT VARIABLE IS CODED 0.                                 
                                                                                
                 CODE 9: THIS CODE FLAGS INAPPLICABLE RESPONSE CATEGORIES. IF   
                 A CATEGORY NUMBER (1-36) IS NOT USED WITHIN A GIVEN            
                 CLASSIFICATION SCHEME BECAUSE IT HAS LESS THAN 36 RESPONSE     
                 CATEGORIES, THEN THE VARIABLE REPRESENTING THE UNUSED          
                 CATEGORY IS INAPPLICABLE FOR THE COUNTRY IN QUESTION AND IS    
                 CODED 9 FOR ALL RESPONDENTS WHO WERE INTERVIEWED THERE.        
                                                                                
                 CLASSIFICATION SCHEMES FOR EACH COUNTRY ARE SHOWN BELOW.>      
0
